intro: Paraia bracteata, commonly known as the golden bell or golden cup, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
